summary: Expand the Mobile Health Care App scope to include a voice assistance feature with an AI chatbot and full in-app navigation control, alongside the existing Design B UI work (excluding appointment booking/scheduling and doctor/provider flows), and add new Sign In/Sign Up screens using full name + phone number + password credentials.
architectural_notes: Consider using the Faker ("flaker") library for generating mock/sample data in the app where needed.
known_issues: Sign out is currently not working (user cannot successfully sign out / session not cleared).

existing_features.title: Implement a complete alternative visual design (Design B) for the Mobile Health Care App inspired by the provided Figma link, including a coherent color palette (avoid blue/purple), typography, spacing system, component styling, and layout rules applied consistently across the app UI.

Create a Design B UI screen set for a Mobile Health Care App with at least these routes/pages: Welcome/Onboarding, Sign In, Home/Dashboard, Doctor/Provider List, Appointment Details, and Profile; each page should be navigable via in-app navigation (tabs and/or header navigation) and should demonstrate the Design B component system.

Add a simple in-app toggle or switcher that allows viewing the alternative Design B UI (and, if an existing design is present, switching between the default design and Design B) without editing any immutable template files.
Generate and add the required static images for the Design B theme under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the Design B UI.
Remove doctor/provider-related navigation and routes from the app so there is no Doctors screen and no doctor/provider bottom-tab entry.
Remove appointment booking and appointment scheduling flows/screens so there is no appointment details screen and no booking actions in the UI.

Update the Home/Dashboard content to remove appointment schedule-related sections (e.g., "Next Appointment", "Appointment Scheduled" activity) and ensure the page remains coherent without appointment data.
Remove or refactor mock data and imports so the frontend builds cleanly without doctor/provider and appointment scheduling mock data being required by any remaining pages.

Update the Home/Dashboard screen (frontend/src/pages/HomeDashboard.tsx) to use a special/custom layout design in the existing Design B style, centered around these sections: "Today's Metrics", "Quick Log" (Water, Steps, Sleep, Calories), and "ML Prediction Categories" (6 categories). The layout should be visually distinct from the current grid-of-cards structure (e.g., mixed card sizes, staggered grid, section-based composition) while remaining responsive for mobile and desktop.

Add dynamic icon behavior to the Home dashboard section items/cards (Today's Metrics, Quick Log items, and ML Prediction Categories). Icons should have noticeable interactive/animated states (e.g., hover/focus/press animations, subtle pulsing for "today" status, or progress-driven motion) implemented with Tailwind/CSS (no external animation libraries). ML Prediction Categories must include these labeled items with the specified icon concepts and color accents: AI Predictions (Brain icon - purple), Weight Loss (Scale icon - green), PCOD/PCOS (Heart icon - pink), Pregnancy Life Cycle (Baby icon - amber), Yoga & Exercise (Dumbbell icon - blue), Stress Management (Sparkles icon - indigo).
Add a voice assistant entry point that is accessible throughout the app (except where navigation is currently hidden) and opens a chat-style assistant UI where users can speak or type commands.
Implement on-device speech features for the assistant: speech-to-text for capturing user commands and optional text-to-speech for reading assistant responses, without using external AI/LLM services.

Add an 'AI chatbot' behavior for the assistant that interprets user messages, produces helpful English responses, and supports 'full navigation' by executing in-app navigation commands for the existing routes.
Persist assistant conversation state locally so users can close and reopen the assistant without losing the current transcript during typical usage sessions.

Update the starting (Welcome) page to remove doctor-related and scheduling-related feature highlights, including the "Expert Doctors" and "Easy Scheduling" tiles, and revise the welcome description copy so it no longer references connecting with doctors/healthcare professionals or managing/booking appointments.
Update the Sign In screen (frontend/src/pages/SignIn.tsx) to support authentication via mobile number and one-time password (OTP) instead of the current email/password form.
Implement a self-contained OTP generation/verification experience in the frontend that works without any external SMS/OTP provider integration.
Keep existing alternate sign-in options available on the Sign In screen (Internet Identity and Continue as Guest) alongside the new phone + OTP flow.

Add a small in-repo utility named "flaker" that can generate realistic-looking demo user profile data (name, email, phone, date of birth, blood type, allergies, and emergency contact) without adding any external dependencies.

Replace the hard-coded MOCK_USER in frontend/src/designB/data/placeholders.ts with a flaker-generated demo profile, while keeping the exported types compatible with existing consumers (e.g., Profile page).
Make the "Sign Out" action on the Profile page actually sign the user out by clearing any active authentication/session state and then navigating the user to the Sign In route.
Ensure Internet Identity logout is reliable by making the logout/clear flow resilient to timing and state issues, and by not leaving the app in a partially-authenticated state after sign out.
Implement a self-contained demo credential store in the frontend to support creating and verifying accounts using Full Name + Phone Number + Password, without any external auth providers.
Create a new Sign Up page that collects Full Name, Phone Number, and Password, validates inputs, creates the local account, and then signs the user in and navigates to /home.

Update the existing Sign In page (frontend/src/pages/SignIn.tsx) to include a phone + password sign-in option and navigation to the new Sign Up route, while keeping existing alternate sign-in options (Internet Identity and Continue as Guest).

Extend local auth session handling to support the new password-based session type, ensure route guarding recognizes it, and ensure the app shell hides navigation on the Sign Up route similarly to Sign In.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create another design variation for the Mobile Health Care App (based on provided Figma file)
Remove appointment booking/appointment schedule and doctor/provider-related screens/flows from the Design B scope
Add dynamic icons for Home dashboard sections/cards (Today's Metrics, Quick Log, ML Prediction Categories)
Create a special/custom layout design for the Home dashboard (Today's Metrics, Quick Log, ML Prediction Categories) in Design B style
Add voice assistance with an AI chatbot that supports full in-app navigation
Remove Doctors and Easy Scheduling entries/CTA from the starting (landing/onboarding) page
Update authentication to support login with mobile number using OTP (one-time password)
Create Sign In and Sign Up flows using full name, phone number, and password (instead of the current auth form)

projectName: Create an alternative UI design for the Mobile Health Care App (Design B)
